runs.comm: stop the press! International cricket takes off in US. Back of a length outside off, low and slow, defended to cover
stays back of a length, around middle this time, pushed towards midwicket
straying on the pads, worked away for the first international run on US soil
back of a length, around off, defended back to the bowler
angled into the pads, worked away to square leg for one
punched away off the front foot, square of the wicket, in front of cover-point, and it's the first international boundary on US soil. Ever
steered away from wide outside off, gets a single
back of a length, into the pads, flicked square on the on side for a couple
cramps him up this time, hit back to the bowler
offcutter, or perhaps jags back off the seam, and almost traps him lbw. Umpire reckons it hit him outside the line of off
fuller ball, hit to mid-off, again slow pace means struggle to time
McCullum is trying to manufacture something here, looks to sweep a medium-pacer, and again manages to get outside the line of off as he misses the shot
length ball, just outside off, and smashed back past the bowler, catchable height for mid-off, but it is hit too straight of him
looks to drive this from outside off and is beaten
slow ball, and it grips the surface and kicks at him, and Redmond has enough time to get out of the way. The pitch is absorbing all the pace on the ball
too slow again, Redmond waits and waits and still doesn't get timing in this punch shot
nice late-cut from out of Sanga's gloves, but there is hardly any pace in the pitch, and the ball doesn't go too far past short third man
hoicked away, no timing again, gets a single to square leg
McScoop! And he has somehow manufactured pace here! Moves axcross the stumps, down on his knees, and somehow makes contact, and the length ball goes sailing over the keeper's head
first international six flying over US soil! And a well-connected slog does it. Length ball, and when McCullum connects, this small boundary won't be big enough to hold it inside

first international wicket on the US soil! McCullum looks to make room and go over extra cover, but is down in by the slowness of the pitch and ends up hitting towards mid-off, where Mathews takes a superb catch diving forward
gets an inside edge onto the pad as he looks to defend the first ball he faces
back of a length, into the pads, punched wide of mid-on for one
full ball, driven straight to mid-off, and they pinch a single

another slower ball, another man gone! Short and wide outside off, has ages to decide where to hit it, flat-batted powerfully, but ended up hitting it straight towards Malinga at mid-on, and like Bob Willis would say, Malinga made no mistake
comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
nice juicy full toss on the hips, and glanced away for four runs, fine of fine leg

slower ball again, drops and runs, Malinga is quick at mid-on, swoops on it, and flicks it onto the stumps, Jonty Rhodes-style. The third umpire finally gets the correct angle after various replays from unhelpful angles, and it shows he is in by a frame
shuffles across the stumps, beaten by the slowness of the wicket again, gets an inside edge onto the pad
presses forward to defend this back-of-a-length delivery
Taylor plays across the line, is beaten, but the ball is headed down the leg side. The real opportunity, though, is at the other end where Nicol is backing up too far, but Malinga misses the stumps
yorker outside off, hit to mid-off
another yorker, middle and off, dug out back to the bowler
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler
another yorker - length is right, but it is down the leg side
back of a length, straightening outside off, edged, and Sanga takes it one-handed, and immediately says it is not a catch, and has come to him on a half-volley
swipes from outside off, misses by a long way, and is lucky that it misses the off stump
pitched-up delivery, pushed to long-on for one
worked away from outside off towards square leg for one
premeditated sweep from outside off, misses and is hit on the pad
flighted delivery, hit straight to mid-on
comes forward, shifts his weight back, and runs this off the face, fine of short third
another premeditated sweep, and again he is beaten outside off
full ball outside off, hit straight to straight extra cover
short, outside off, punched to sweeper-cover - doesn't have the pace on it to cut it
chips down the track and plays a nice little chip shot, over mid-off, and two bounces into the boundary
quicker ball, short, and he pulls at it, but it stays low and passes under his bat
back of a length, outside off, punched to straight extra cover
short, outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
flighted around off, swept away to deep square leg for one
floater outside off, is beaten on the cut shot, goes under his bat
pushed for four! Lovely timing towards extra cover, and sweeper-cover, Mendis dives too early on it
shooter this time, cuts this short delivery inches off the ground, and comes back for two after hitting it square enough of third man to come back for two
into the pads, worked away for one
played on. He has had enough of this slow and low pitch, finally plays the unwise shot, looking to punch this one into the off side, and not for the first time he gets an inside edge
back of a length, pushed down the ground, and Kapugedera from straight extra cover dives full length to stop the single
full outside off, pushed to long-on for one
beaten by low bounce as he looks to punch one outside off
inside edge as he looks to drive down the ground, gets a single, though
hit back at the bowler, Perera misfields, lets them go through for a single
punched square of the wicket, straight to Dilshan at backward point
starts off with a carrom ball, stays low outside off, pushed to cover
short outside off, cut away to sweeper-cover
another shooter, Taylor does well to cover the line of it, and also manages to get a single to cover
guided to backward point for one
legbreak, stays low again, gets an outside edge towards short third man
fuller, outside off, pushed to short cover
drives outside off, plays outside the line of the ball, and is beaten
charges down the wicket, makes room too, mis-hits towards long-on for one
slower ball, worked away towards midwicket for one
stays low, into the pads, worked away to deep square leg
good yorker, no room either, played back to the bowler
superb shot, considering the slow and pitch, driven on the up, through extra cover, gets a rare boundary
comes down the track, looks to go inside out, ends up slicing it much straighter than he wants, but it is still wide enough of long-on, Malinga
comes down the track again, Mendis floats this higher, Styris is beaten in the flight, and heaves at it. Gets an inside edge onto the pad, and an overthrow makes it two runs
charges at him again and pushes it down to long-off
short outside off, cut away for a single
this was a long way coming, looks for the huge sweep shot, Mendis holds the ball back, a googly, and furthermore the low bounce betas him too. leg stump gone
sweeps the first ball he faces, and gets off the mark with a single to fine leg
wide down the leg side
looks to hit this down the ground, no timing again, low, slow, and he gets a single towards long-off
hit down the ground, and Mahela from straight midwicket makes a diving save
pushed into the on side with soft hands, and he comes back for a couple

yorker outside off, and Taylor has run himself out. He knows the boundaries aren't coming and he takes the risky second, having dug this straight to third man. Kulasekara's throw is accurate, and he is caught way short
back of a length, outside off, drops and runs
worked away off the pads, to short fine leg for one
chips down the track and chips it to deep square leg for one
played in front of his front pad, worked away from outside off towards square leg
goes for the huge, ugly sweep, gets the toe end for a single to short third
carrom ball, outside off, worked into the on side for one
down the wicket again, no timing again, gets a single to long-off
back of a length, punched to long-on for one
short and wide, punched away, wide of point, will come back for two
short and wide again, slower this time, and he has to hit in front of square, straight towards sweeper-cover
makes room, plays the chip shot, and Randiv misfields at sweeper-cover to let them come back for two
backs away again, gets a single to sweeper-cover
low full toss, hit to long-off, Mendis, fast earning a distinction for poor outfielding, fumbles twice and gives away the second run
this time Mendis does well at long-off to keep them down to one
back of a length, hit straight back to the bowler

what do you do Jack? The pitch is low and slow, and it's a T20 and run-rate is crucial. So he gives Mendis the charge, creates enough room to free his arms, reads the length and line right. But. But. But the ball hardly leaves the ground upon pitching. Poor guy is bowled
looks to cut this one, playing for the legbreak, but it goes straight on and gets an inside edge onto the pad
paddled away to short fine for one
Vettori's patented slap-sweep, taking the front leg out of the way, sweeping it in front of square, and all along the ground, gets a single
skidding towards his pads, pushed to midwicket
Vettori makes room and plays him square on the off side, gets a single
slower ball, ends up being a low full toss, which he pushes down the ground, not powerfully, hence it allows Vettori to come back for the second
shorter delivery, McCullum bunts and runs
misses the yorker by about a foot, and Vettori likes the pace of Malinga, getting under it and chipping it past extra cover. Rare boundary, important boundary for NZ
slower ball, beats him outside off, gets a dot ball through
another slower ball, shuffles across and runs it down to third man, where a Dilshan fumble allows him to come back for two
short ball, walks down the track and flat-bats it to long-on
Vettori makes room, Kula gets the yorker correct, only a single ensues
another yorker, swinging down the leg side, beating McCullum as he makes room
slower ball, waits and waits for it, and then hits wide of extra cover, Jayasinghe has a chance, but it bursts through his hands
fuller and quicker, hit wide of long-on, rushes back for two
full and straight, hit powerfully and straight to long-on, will be just a one
short ball, outside off, McCullum aborts the pull shot and leaves it alone, expecting it to be called wide, but Ian Gould reckons it is close enough to him
slower bouncer, it's near impossible to time those on this pitch, and he holes out to deep square leg
slower ball outside off, run down to third man for one
leg-stump yorker, steals a single to midwicket
slower ball outside off again, this time Gould calls it a wide, and they run one too off the Sanga fumble
slower ball, gets just a single to cover
length ball, slogs with all his might, still no timing, but clears the circle on the on side and comes back for two
